org.liris.smartgov.simulator.urban.osm.environment.graph

Class Road

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.urban.osm.environment.graph.OsmWay
      • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.urban.osm.environment.graph.Road

  • public class Road
extends OsmWay
    A Road is a particular OsmWay where agents can move.

      • Road

        public Road(java.lang.String id,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> nodeRefs)
        JsonCreator used to load Roads from a Json file.

        Can also be used to create roads manually.

        Parameters:
        id - road id
        nodeRefs - an ordered list of node ids

    • Method Detail

      • isOneway

        public boolean isOneway()
        If the road is oneway, the graph will only include arcs that connect road nodes in order. Else, arcs for the reverse nodes order will also be created.
        Returns:
        true if the road is oneway

      • setOneway

        public void setOneway(boolean oneway)
        Sets the oneway attribute of this road.

        Might be used to replace the default OSM value when fixing dead ends for example.

        Parameters:
        oneway - oneway value

      • getHighway

        public Highway getHighway()
        Returns the highway type of this road.
        Returns:
        highway type

      • getService

        public Service getService()
        Returns the service type of this road, if any. Default value set to NONE.
        Returns:
        service type

      • distanceBetweenAgentAndLeader

        public double distanceBetweenAgentAndLeader(OsmAgentBody agent)
        Computes the distance between the specified agent and its leader on the road.
        Parameters:
        agent - follower agent
        Returns:
        distance between leader and follower, in meter

      • addAgent

        public void addAgent(OsmAgentBody agentBody)
        Adds an agent to the road.

        The direction to which the agent should be added is determined by the direction of its current arc, retrieved from its plan.

        Notice that the agent does not necessarily need to be at the origin of the road to use this function. If it's added from a node in the middle of the road, its position will be computed accordingly so that the follower / leader system keeps consistent.

        This method is synchronized, so that multiple threads can safely add agents on the same road concurrently.

        Parameters:
        agentBody - body of the agent entering the road

      • removeAgent

        public void removeAgent(OsmAgentBody agentBody)
        Removes an agent from this road.
        Parameters:
        agentBody - body of the agent to remove

      • getForwardAgents

        public java.util.List<OsmAgentBody> getForwardAgents()
        An ordered list of agents on this road in the forward direction. The first agent of the list is the leader of all the others, so that the first item of the list corresponds to the first agent of the road in terms of circulation.
        Returns:
        an umodifiable representation of the agents on the road in the forward direction

      • getBackwardAgents

        public java.util.List<OsmAgentBody> getBackwardAgents()
        An ordered list of agents on this road in the backward direction. The first agent of the list is the leader of all the others, so that the first item of the list corresponds to the first agent of the road in terms of circulation.
        Returns:
        an umodifiable representation of the agents on the road in the backward direction

      • leaderOfAgent

        public OsmAgentBody leaderOfAgent(MovingAgentBody agentBody)
        Returns the leader of the specified agent, in the direction determined by the direction of its current arc, according to the agent plan.
        Parameters:
        agentBody - follower agent
        Returns:
        leader agent of the specified agent on this road

      • distanceBetweenTwoAgents

        public double distanceBetweenTwoAgents(OsmAgentBody leader,
                                       OsmAgentBody follower)
        Compute the distance between two agents along the current road, taking into account road breaks (nodes and arcs between agents).

        Computing the direct distance between two agents doesn't make much sense in general : use this function to compute the real distance between agents, along the road.

        Also make sure that the follower is really located after the leader on the road. If leader and follower are not on this road, or are exchanged, unexpected things might happen. This could be hard checked in the function, but for efficiency purposes we will leave this responsibility to the user, at least for now.

        Parameters:
        leader - first agent
        follower - second agent
        Returns:
        distance between the two agents, in meter
